properties.name: University of Massachusetts Amherst
properties.orgDescription: The University of Massachusetts Amherst is a public research university offering a wide range of academic programs across disciplines. Within its Department of Earth, Geographic, and Climate Sciences, the one-year master’s concentration in Geographic Information Science and Technology (GIST) provides focused training in spatial analysis, remote sensing, and GIS application development. The program prepares students for applied work in environmental planning, transportation, and public policy through a combination of technical coursework and practical experience.
properties.description: I completed my graduate degree in Geographic Information Science and Technology (GIST) at UMass Amherst, where I gained hands-on experience in spatial analysis, remote sensing, and GIS application design. The program emphasized both technical proficiency and real-world impact, preparing me to contribute to transportation and environmental data projects with confidence and precision. My coursework and practicum experiences laid the foundation for my work with organizations like MassDOT and the Charles River Conservancy.
properties.galleryHTML: Click the images to enlarge in a new window.

properties.name: Charles River Conservancy
properties.orgDescription: The Charles River Conservancy is a nonprofit organization dedicated to enhancing and maintaining the parks and natural habitats along the Charles River in Greater Boston. Through ecological restoration, volunteer stewardship, and public engagement, CRC works to preserve biodiversity and promote equitable access to green spaces. Its initiatives include invasive species management, environmental monitoring, and creative programming in urban wilds like Hell’s Half Acre.
properties.description: As a volunteer with CRC, I contributed over 80 hours to invasive species monitoring and urban park restoration along the Charles and in Hell’s Half Acre, an urban wild in Cambridge, MA. In addition to my fieldwork as a CREW Steward and Vegetation Monitor, I developed an ArcGIS dashboard as part of a final project for one of my graduate courses. The tool visualizes plant coverage data collected by volunteers and is now featured on CRC’s website. Though created independently, the dashboard was designed to support CRC’s restoration efforts and make ecological data more accessible to both the organization and the public.
properties.galleryHTML: Click the image to explore the dashboard!

properties.name: 18b TIP
properties.orgDescription: 18b TIP is a community-based initiative in Suffolk County, NY that supports formerly incarcerated individuals through social work, resource navigation, and reintegration services. The program focuses on personalized outreach and geographic accessibility, helping clients connect with housing, employment, health care, and other essential services as they transition back into society.
properties.description: At 18b TIP, I led the development of an interactive GIS dashboard using ArcGIS Experience Builder to centralize community resources for formerly incarcerated individuals in Suffolk County. The dashboard is actively used by the organization’s team of social workers and their interns to recommend geographically relevant services to their clients. Working iteratively with my supervisor, I structured the data, designed the interface, and introduced layered filtering tools to support intuitive navigation and personalized outreach. The dashboard continues to evolve as the team’s needs grow, offering a flexible platform for ongoing updates and community engagement.
properties.galleryHTML: Click the images to enlarge in a new window.

properties.name: MassDOT
properties.orgDescription: The Massachusetts Department of Transportation (MassDOT) oversees transportation infrastructure across the Commonwealth, including highways, public transit, aeronautics, and rail. Through its divisions and open data initiatives, MassDOT supports planning, safety, and accessibility efforts statewide. The agency maintains a robust GIS program that provides spatial datasets for roadways, environmental assets, multimodal networks, and more.
properties.description: As part of my graduate practicum, I worked remotely with MassDOT to digitize speed regulation records into a centralized GIS layer. My focus was on Southeast Massachusetts, contributing to a broader effort to improve data consistency and accessibility across the state. While I didn’t visit the region in person, the project gave me practical experience with structured workflows and highlighted how foundational GIS work supports larger transportation planning initiatives. This foundational effort supported broader planning and analysis across the agency.
